nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,8 +5,11 @@
 # alert - configurations for the Alert Pod
 alert:
   image: "docker.io/blackducksoftware/blackduck-alert:VERSION_TOKEN"
-  limitMemory: "2560M"
-  requestMemory: "2560M"
+  resources:
+    limits:
+      memory: "2560M"
+    requests:
+      memory: "2560M"

nodes.bodyText: Nice find! I switched it to Mi
nodes.diffHunk:

@@ -17,8 +20,11 @@ deployAlertWithBlackDuck: false
 enableStandalone: true
 cfssl:
   image: "docker.io/blackducksoftware/blackduck-cfssl:1.0.0"
-  limitMemory: "640M"
-  requestMemory: "640M"
+  resources:
+    limits:
+      memory: "640M"
+    requests:
+      memory: "640M"

nodes.bodyText: Also, I'm not sure why we use 640, whereas the docker-compose file specifies 512: https://github.com/blackducksoftware/blackduck-alert/blob/5.2.1/deployment/docker-compose/standalone/docker-compose.yml#L13

-  limitMemory: "640M"
-  requestMemory: "640M"
+  resources:
+    limits:
+      memory: "640M"
+    requests:
+      memory: "640M"

nodes.bodyText: Interesting, so this may also be a bug, since Black Duck also specifies 512 for the cfssl container: https://github.com/blackducksoftware/hub/blob/v2019.12.1/docker-compose/docker-compose.yml#L107
